net.sf.javaml.featureselection
Interface FeatureSelection

All Known Subinterfaces:
FeatureRanking, FeatureScoring, FeatureSubsetSelection
All Known Implementing Classes:
GainRatio, GreedyBackwardElimination, GreedyForwardSelection, KullbackLeiblerDivergence, LinearRankingEnsemble, RandomForestAttributeEvaluation, RankingFromScoring, RecursiveFeatureEliminationSVM, RELIEF, SymmetricalUncertainty, WekaAttributeSelection
public interface FeatureSelection

Top-level interface for feature selection algorithms. There are three main types of features selection: (i) feature scoring, (ii) feature ranking and (iii) feature subset selection. Feature scoring is the most general method and can be converted in the latter two, while feature ranking can only be turned into feature subset selection methods. Each type of feature selection has its own interface that inherits from this one.

Author:
Thomas Abeel (thomas@abeel.be)
See Also:
FeatureScoring, FeatureRanking, FeatureSubsetSelection

Method Detail

build

void build(Dataset data)
Build the attribute evaluation on the supplied data set. Note: This method can change the data set that is supplied to the method!

Parameters:
data - data set to train the attribute evaluation algorithm on.

int noAttributes()
Returns the number of attributes that have been ranked, scored or selected.

Returns:
